/wiki/Bic_(cycling_team): Bic was a French professional cycling team active from 1967 to 1974 . It was sponsored by the French consumer goods company Bic .
/wiki/Molteni: Molteni was an Italian professional road bicycle racing team from 1958 until the end of 1976 . It won 663 races , many of them earned by its most famous rider , Eddy Merckx . Other riders included Gianni Motta and Marino Basso , who contributed 48 and 34 wins respectively . The Molteni family continues in cycling with sponsorship of Salmilano . The sponsors Molteni were Italian salami manufacturers based in Arcore , near Milan .
/wiki/Peugeot_(cycling_team): Peugeot team was a French professional cycling team that promoted and rode Peugeot racing bikes . It is listed as the most successful cycling team of all time , on cyclingranking.com , with a large margin on the second placed team , Alcyon .
/wiki/Gitane\u2013Campagnolo: Gitane-Campagnolo was a French professional cycling team that existed from 1969 to 1977 . Its main sponsor was the French bicycle manufacturer Gitane .
/wiki/Ferretti_(cycling_team): Ferretti was an Italian professional cycling team that existed from 1969 to 1972 . It was sponsored by the Ferretti kitchen company , based in Capannoli . Gösta Pettersson won the general classification of the 1971 Giro d'Italia with the team .
/wiki/Kas_(cycling_team): Kas was a Spanish-based professional cycling team which was active from 1958 until 1979 and again for three years in the 1980s . Its name was derived from the name of the principal sponsor of the team , the soft drinks manufacturer , Kas . The team was principally based in Vitoria-Gasteiz , Spain . Its riders typically wore a jersey that consisted of yellow and blue .
/wiki/Werner_(cycling_team): Werner was a Spanish professional cycling team that existed from 1969 to 1972 . It participated in the 1971 Tour de France .
/wiki/Mercier_(cycling_team): Mercier was a French professional cycling team that promoted and raced on Mercier racing bikes . Together with the Peugeot team , the Mercier team had a long presence in the cycling sport and in the Tour de France from 1935 until 1984 .
/wiki/Flandria_(cycling_team): Flandria was a Belgian professional cycling team that existed from 1957 to 1979 . It was sponsored by Flandria a bicycle manufacturer located in West Flanders that also manufactures mopeds , lawnmowers , and motorbikes .
/wiki/Frimatic\u2013de_Gribaldy: Frimatic-de Gribaldy was a French professional cycling team that existed from 1968 to 1971 . It was created by former rider Jean de Gribaldy . Its main sponsor was French refrigerator manufacturer Frimatic .
